ref: 4781 *cikka3 ʻ small ʼ. [Cf. cikva -- m. ʻ young elephant ʼ, cikkagaja -- m.; cikṣa -- ʻ young ʼ, *ciṅga -- : perh. same as cikká -- 4, cikiná -- ʻ flat -- nosed ʼ Pāṇ., cikina -- ʻ flattened, stumpy ʼ Harṣac. -- ← Drav. (cf. Kan. cikka ʻ small ʼ) LM 330, T. Burrow BSOAS 12, 379]
Pk. cikka -- ʻ small ʼ, ˚kā -- f. ʻ anything small, slight rain, small drop ʼ;
M. cike ʻ a little ʼ, cikkar small. --
Kho. (Lor.) ċik ʻ younger, small (of animals and things) ʼ?
